channel.title: Journal of Peace Research on
channel.description: Recent content in Journal of Peace Research on

item.title: Defending Benign Mercantilism
item.description: In this review of Robert Gilpin’s Political Economy of International Relations, Strange again argues against ‘Hegemonic Stability Theory’, see (1987), but has started to develop a theory of transnational empire to explain the structural power of the United States. Part of this argument is the increasing non-territoriality of structural power, which is developed in a number of works below. Journal of Peace Research. Volume: 25 Issue: 3. Pages 273-277
